radiographic_examinations.findings: Hyperintense signal image in the spinal cord from T6 to T11 levels in T2 and short tau inversion recovery (STIR) sequences, occupying more than 80% of the circumference of the spinal cord in axial sections, consistent with cytotoxic edema or myelomalacia. Enlarged perimedullary vessels in the posterior epidural region, with hyperintense signal voids in T1 and a hypointense signal in T2 sequences.
Right perimedullary fistula type I, with a feeding artery of the radiculopial branch and a perimedullary venous drainage of the segmental artery of the right L2.
